projects.title: CanGo
projects.description: A web app for Brown + RISD students to search for and publicize student events, from karaoke nights to matcha making sessions. Includes a smart recommendation algorithm to recommend events based on personal interests, past event ratings, number of friends attending, and more. Click here to learn more!

projects.title: Dash Web App
projects.description: As a lead developer at Dash, a large-scale hypertext media app, I build tools that help users create, reflect, and stay organized. So far, my work has spanned AI-powered text augmentation to support better writing, building custom journaling tools with generative prompts, and dynamic task nodes that streamline personal workflows.

projects.title: Hack@Brown 2025, 2026
projects.description: As lead designer for H@B, Brown's annual hackathon, I define and pitch a unique creative theme each year, and help bring it to life through a cohesive webpage and social media design. From designing 2D and 3D assets in Illustrator and Blender to building animated web prototypes in Figma, our team works to ensure that every element aligns with the hackathon's artistic vision.

projects.title: Neural Canvas
projects.description: This project is a text-to-art image stylization system. When a user inputs an image and text prompt describing a desired theme, the system selects and blends artistic styles, using an ML model to apply the blended style to their image. Alongside building our image classification and neural transfer pipeline, we wrote a paper comparing different style application methods and model optimization techniques.

projects.title: Haptic Earthquake Visualization
projects.description: I built an AR app that visualizes earthquake data, combining map-based overlays with custom haptic (tactile) feedback to represent magnitude, depth, and geographic impact. I conducted a user study comparing multiple visualization variants‚Äî 2D vs. AR, haptic vs. non-haptic, focused vs. comprehensive‚Äî to analyze what UX components maximized engagement, recall, and comprehension in AR.

projects.title: Brown Student Radio
projects.description: As part of FullStack @ Brown, our team built a new website for Brown Student Radio. I communicated with the client to define their needs and design priorities, and helped implement key pages including About, Schedule, People, Blog, and Contact. I integrated Cosmic as a content management system to allow team members to update content without having to code, and set up authentication + protected access using Firebase.

projects.title: Pottery at Brown
projects.description: At FullStack @ Brown, my team designed and developed a website for Pottery at Brown. I helped build dynamic pages for class listings, instructor bios, studio access, and contact info, and integrated Cosmic CMS to give the team control over their content. I also implemented authentication to manage admin-only editing privileges.

projects.title: Water Supply Data Visualization
projects.description: I built an AR app that visualizes household water availability across countries, using volumetric simulations to represent life-size water quantities. In a user study, I compared the AR version to existing charts and tables of the same data to study trade-offs between immersion and analytical clarity in spatialized data displays.
